This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**F3.3 Rice paddies**](/efg-info/F3_3.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/altmap-info/F3_3_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: F3.3.web.alt v2.0.

> The distribution of rice paddies was estimated from the percentage of rice cover at a 5 arc minute  resolution based on Monfreda et al. (2008). Cells with > 10% rice cover were designated as major occurrences, and those with 1-10% rice cover were designated as minor occurrences.

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::

 Resolution: >1km, periods/epochs.
 Accuracy evaluation: quantitative (variable).

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Web navigation (**code: F3.3.web.alt**, version v2.0) 
 - Indicative Map (**code: F3.3.IM.alt**, version v2.0) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**F3.3.web.alt** (v2.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/F3.3.web.alt_v2.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090997){target="gisdata"} :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.F3_3_web_alt){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"}

**F3.3.IM.alt** (v2.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/F3.3.IM.alt_v2.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.
